text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm and welcome to be found on food
buzz 24 item tasting menu inspired by
food buzz and part of food buzzes 24
meals and 24 hours on 24 blogs
incredible historic blogging event and
this is the beginning items 1 through 8
and of course there's 24 roses there all
right I am joined by from left to right
my cousin Tony who's also a chef in San
Francisco my beautiful wife Michelle
super foodie and on the right we have
the lovely and talented Tony's
girlfriend
Nora they'll be joining me to share in
this epic dinner so on to the first
course which is caviar on Pringles and I
have to admit this is the only item that
was not inspired by serving food buzz
this is all me this is paddlefish
sturgeon caviar on a Pringle and you
know what if this is wrong I don't want
to be right because I thought it was
very delicious now Nora was eating
caviar for the first time and I've
captured here in slow motion video her
reaction which is very typical someone
eating this for the first time she's not
sure so I think she likes it alright on
to the next items that were made up of
tuna
here we are with item number two this is
a tuna poke a what tuna polka is it's a
marinated usually ahi tuna that's diced
and seasoned and here's what I did I
took some sushi grade tuna and you want
to diced up you want to get the finest
tuna you can get and then I did some
grated ginger now some people put diced
in here I like to grate it really fine
on a cheese grater and see that I'm just
going to squeeze it between my fingers
and you just get that perfect ginger
juice and that works really nice some
green onion some sambal hot pepper a
little bit of soy sauce and that's it
nice and simple really delicious on a
fried wonton chip that's a little piece
of key lime there really really nice
little bite there so that was number two
number three was a seared tuna and this
was kind of a Provencal kind of a
Mediterranean French
cumin crusted tuna loin all this was cut
from the same piece of tuna and when you
do this you just want to sear it for
maybe 20 seconds per side you just want
to kind of flip it from side to side get
all four sides seared and then when you
slice it look at that you could say
incredible rare inside and seared on the
outside I put that on some French green
beans with some black olive tapenade the
saltiness of the olive with the kind of
aromatic rubbed buttery tuna incredible
all right item number four is a tuna
stuffed tomato so these were the
trimmings of the tuna so I did a little
herb oil on the plate and then I took
the tuna I poached it really gently in
olive oil
I added some capers a little garlic some
basil and salt and it just went stuffed
in that early girl tomato that's from
wild boar farms incredibly delicious
that was a great bite
all right on to the next trio of fish
items this was number five smoked salmon
this is Charlie Trotter a chef from
Chicago and he did this really beautiful
citrus cured smoked salmon I got this at
Whole Foods had a little bit of
sweetness the citrus was really nice I
thought a great garnish with this would
be fried capers and what you do is just
put those in a pan and they kind of fry
up and intensifies that caper briny
flavor really good with the salmon all
right on to item six this was a shrimp
cocktail this was one of my favorite
courses
it was a wild gulf shrimp and what I did
is I juiced some sweet 100 Tomatoes I
was going to put this shrimp on top of
like a sweet tomato juice but I got the
idea I squeezed the cherry tomatoes out
and I basically put him in my serving
spoon which was a wanton spoon which you
know is very fashionable to serve things
in like five years ago but I'm just
catching up
so I froze that on the spoon so that was
like tomato ice and then I put the
shrimp on with some avocado a little
cocktail sauce and the ice just kind of
melted and became a little slushy that
was really really good
so anyway that was a shrimp cocktail
course seven was a seared salmon this
came out really well this
was a seared piece of salmon it was kind
of cut towards the belly so it was nice
and fatty there's Tony plating up some
of this diced cucumber with yogurt and
dill and then the salmon was simply
salted and seared in some grapeseed oil
nice neutral oil because I wanted to be
able to taste that cucumber underneath
and also the reason I used a neutral oil
I serve this with a smoked paprika oil
that's going to be a bonus demo on the
site how to make that so anyway that
seared salmon on some tilled cucumber
smoked paprika really nice item eight a
butter lettuce salad so this kind of
cleaned the palate here we have just
beautiful delicate sweet butter lettuce
a sweet herb dressing and some raw
pumpkin seeds just to finish it off and
that's the end of the beginning
so stay tuned for the next two videos
and as always enjoy
[Music]
